result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

from 01/11/16 motion hearing held before Judge Jill Falstad in Br. 1
Atty Richard Lawson
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance for J.J.B. - Witness uncooperative and avoiding service - for Jury Trial on 3/10/16
of Right to Attorney

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 8:42am
State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer; Deft appears in person with Atty Austin Mort
Date and time was set for one day jury trial

State first addresses MIL and provided to court amended criminal complaint of having a total of 6 counts now
State says deft was very agitated prior to coming on record 
Atty Mort states deft wishes to represent self and proceed with no attorney today
Atty Mort states deft raised waiver of attorney this morning prior to coming on record
Atty Mort states defense counsel is ready to proceed with jury trial today
COURT questions deft wanting to represent himself
Deft believes he is capable of representing himself at jury trial without attorney
State proceeds with addressed amended criminal complaint of now having Counts 1-3 as Possession of THC, Count 4 is Possession of Drug Paraphernalia, Count 5 is DC, and Count 6 is Bail Jumping- Misdemeanor
COURT questions deft on all counts of amended criminal complaint
Deft states he understands all 6 counts against him and the penalties that could be imposed on each count
COURT asks deft to complete waiver of right to attorney form
Deft completes waiver of right to attorney form
OTR: 8:53am 
BOTR: 9:01am
COURT receives waiver of right to attorney form and questions deft regarding form
Deft understands all rights that may be waived if representing himself
COURT provides options to deft of representation
Deft still wishes to proceed without attorney
State says they would like to proceed with jury trial today, however state is unsure how much evidence deft has been given
Atty Mort states defense counsel has reviewed squad cam video but deft has not reviewed video
COURT questions Atty Mort as to why deft has not been given access to watching squad cam video
Atty Mort makes statement for reasons why deft has not been provided video
COURT raises concerns with both parites as to deft not fully understanding all legal aspects of proceeding with jury trial without an attorney
COURT questions Atty Mort if public defender's office provides stand-by counsel
Atty Mort's supervisor, Atty Suzanne O'Neill was present sitting in back of courtroom and Atty O'Neill states the public defender's office does not provide clients with stand-by counsel
COURT does not allow defendant to proceed today without some type of counsel representation
COURT allows Atty Mort to withdraw from case due to public defender's office not providing stand-by counsel
COURT appoints Atty Richard Lawson as stand-by counsel
COURT advises state and Atty Mort to provide all discovery, evidence, and MIL to Atty Lawson to review
COURT will reset matter for defendant to have time to speak with Atty Lawson and to determine if Atty Lawson will accept deft case
